contained.name: is_strictly_comparable_to
contained.title: is_strictly_comparable_to
contained.description: Test if two instances are strictly comparable. Effected in descendants.

contained.name: is_simple
contained.title: is_simple
contained.description: True if this quantity has no reference ranges.

contained.name: is_normal
contained.title: is_normal
contained.description: Value is in the normal range, determined by comparison of the value to `_normal_range_` if present, or by the `_normal_status_` marker if present.

contained.name: less_than
contained.title: less_than
contained.description: True if this Ordered object is less than `_other_`. Redefined in descendants.

name: DV_ORDERED
title: DV_ORDERED
description:
Abstract class defining the concept of ordered values, which includes ordinals as well as true quantities. It defines the functions  `<` and `_is_strictly_comparable_to()_`, the latter of which must evaluate to `True` for instances being compared with the  `<` function, or used as limits in the `DV_INTERVAL<T>` class. 

Data value types which are to be used as limits in the `DV_INTERVAL<T>` class must inherit from this class, and implement the function `_is_strictly_comparable_to()_` to ensure that instances compare meaningfully. For example, instances of `DV_QUANTITY` can only be compared if they measure the same kind of physical quantity.

element.short: Abstract class defining the concept of ordered values, which includes ordinals as well as true quantities.
element.definition:
Abstract class defining the concept of ordered values, which includes ordinals as well as true quantities. It defines the functions  `<` and `_is_strictly_comparable_to()_`, the latter of which must evaluate to `True` for instances being compared with the  `<` function, or used as limits in the `DV_INTERVAL<T>` class. 

Data value types which are to be used as limits in the `DV_INTERVAL<T>` class must inherit from this class, and implement the function `_is_strictly_comparable_to()_` to ensure that instances compare meaningfully. For example, instances of `DV_QUANTITY` can only be compared if they measure the same kind of physical quantity.

constraint.human: Other reference ranges validity must be present
Is simple validity must satisfy conditional constraints
Normal range and status consistency must be present

element.short: Optional normal status indicator of value with respect to normal range for this value.
element.definition: Optional normal status indicator of value with respect to normal range for this value. Often included by lab, even if the normal range itself is not included. Coded by ordinals in series HHH, HH, H, (nothing), L, LL, LLL; see openEHR terminology group  `normal_status`.

element.short: Optional tagged other reference ranges for this value in its particular measurement context.
element.definition: Optional tagged other reference ranges for this value in its particular measurement context.
